results.title: Health in Greece
results.brief_description: Greece is today (1953) among the most devastated countries in Europe, with widespread poverty, sickness and suffering. Help has come from many countries, through the United Nations and other organisations; from Scandinavia, Switzerland, Britain and America. In addition, Greek people are being sent to other countries to gain the knowledge needed to set their country on the road to a better life.

results.title: Health habits for a healthy life (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications, James Ganzer and Ron Casden
results.brief_description: Explains, through animation, the physiological workings of the cardiac, circulatory and respiratory systems. Outlines and stresses the importance of the pyramid of health, which includes proper nutrition, regular exercise and social well-being.

results.title: Health centres: the Canberra concept
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and John Sexton
results.brief_description: Two Canberra Community Health Centres show how a centre works in its community and how it fulfils the concept of catering for health needs where they arise.

results.title: Health centres of Burma
results.brief_description: As part of a vigorous program to improve the welfare of its people, the Burmese Government has called in the help of WHO to supply laboratory equipment, supplies and instruction in connection with child welfare, dental health and general medical services.

results.title: Health begins at home
results.creator_credit: Soluzmultfilm, Moscow, WHO and Ivan Ivanov-Vano
results.brief_description: Animated film on public health and health education. The spirit of sickness decides to concentrate on a house where a family lives happily and healthily. After much effort the “spirit” manages to install himself but with the help of the medical services the family finally evicts the evil “spirit” and returns to normal life. The spirit seeks other homes where he may inflict disease and misery but the health services are busy protecting the people.

results.title: Health and Fitness at Work-It Works
results.creator_credit: Department Sports and Australia. Dept. of Sport, Recreation and Tourism
results.brief_description: The physical fitness of a company’s employees can make an important contribution to the fiscal health of the whole organisation. It is now well recognised that healthy employees are more productive, are absent less frequently, and suffer fewer of the illnesses which plague modern life. Health and fitness programs at work are extremely successful in encouraging new health habits with important benefits for both employees and employers.
